table_schema: CREATE TABLE cards (uuid TEXT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, flavorText TEXT, text TEXT, type TEXT)
question: Which cards have flavor text with negative sentiment?

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Ostiary Thrull
hypothetical_relevant_data.flavorText: Orzhov churches don't pass the plate for collection. They charge for admission.

udf_justification: Standard SQL cannot analyze sentiment in text. An LLM UDF is needed to evaluate the emotional tone of flavorText.

table_schema:
CREATE TABLE users (
  Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  AboutMe TEXT,
  DisplayName TEXT,
  Reputation INTEGER
)
question: Find users with AboutMe descriptions having a negative sentiment (score below -0.5)
udf_justification: The sentiment analysis UDF provides a numeric score revealing emotional tone. Standard SQL cannot perform this nuanced text analysis, requiring an LLM-based approach to interpret subtle emotional content.

table_schema:
CREATE TABLE posts (
  Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  Body TEXT,
  Title TEXT,
  Score INTEGER
)
question: Identify posts with highly positive sentiment (score > 0.7)
udf_justification: Detecting nuanced positive sentiment requires sophisticated language understanding beyond simple keyword matching. An LLM UDF generates a precise sentiment score capturing emotional undertones.

table_schema:
CREATE TABLE users (
  Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  AboutMe TEXT,
  DisplayName TEXT,
  Reputation INTEGER
)
question: Find user AboutMe descriptions with neutral sentiment (between 0.2 ,-0.2)
udf_justification: Identifying constructive and supportive sentiment requires contextual understanding that goes beyond literal text interpretation. An LLM UDF generates a precise sentiment score capturing nuanced positive tones.

table_schema:
CREATE TABLE posts (
  Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  Body TEXT,
  Title TEXT,
  Score INTEGER
)
question: Identify posts with slightly negative sentiment below -0.0
udf_justification: Detecting nuanced critical sentiment requires sophisticated natural language processing that provides a precise emotional scoring mechanism. An LLM-based UDF captures the analytical and critical tone of technical discussions.

table_schema:
CREATE TABLE rulings (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  text TEXT,
  date DATE
)
question: Find rulings with sentiment outside the neutral range (-0.2 to 0.2)
expected_result: Ids of rulings with distinctive emotional tone
udf_justification: Understanding the subtle emotional undertones in technical rulings requires advanced contextual analysis that provides a nuanced sentiment score. An LLM UDF captures the intricate emotional nuances of rule interpretations.
